tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

Possible meanings are 1) "song people sang while going up to Jerusalem for a celebration" or 2) "song people sang while going up the steps into the temple" or 3) "song whose words are like steps." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:120:001|120:1]]

tn.ref: my heart is not proud or my eyes haughty
tn.text: The heart and the eyes represent the person. AT: "I am not proud or haughty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I do not have great hopes for myself
tn.text: Possible meanings are "I do not expect to do great things" or "I do not think I am great."

Things that are too hard for a person to understand are spoken of as if they are beyond the person or too far away from the person to be able to reach them. AT:  "things that are too hard to understand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I have stilled and quieted my soul
tn.text: The soul represents the person or his emotions. Being calm and peaceful is spoken of has having making one's soul still and quiet. AT: "I am calm and peaceful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The soul represents the person or his emotions. AT: "I" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: a weaned child with his mother
tn.text: The psalmist speaks of himself being content and resting as if he were a young child that no longer demands breast milk from his mother. AT: "content like a young child that no longer cries for breast milk but rests in his mother's arms" or "content and resting"  (See:  [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
